description: a(1)=1, a(2)=2; thereafter successive products of pairs of digits make further digits.
comments: The numbers 0, 5, 7, and 9 never appear, but arbitrarily long sequences of 8's appear.
references: Erich Friedman, Puzzles of the Week, http://www2.stetson.edu/~efriedma/mathpuzzle/
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..15212
mathematica: t = {1, 2}; Do[ t = Join[t, IntegerDigits[t[[n-1]] t[[n-2]]]], {n, 3, 100}]; t
author: _Erich Friedman_
